text: Harlow Hill is a small village in Northumberland, England, in the civil parish of Stamfordham. Harlow Hill lies on the line of Hadrian's Wall, and is the site of Milecastle 16. The Military Road also passes by the village. Harlow Hill was historically a township in the ancient parish of Ovingham. It became a separate civil parish in 1866. The civil parish was abolished in 1955, when it was merged with other parishes to create the civil parish of Stamfordham.Vision of Britain website == References == == External links == Category:Villages in Northumberland Category:Former civil parishes in Northumberland
title: Harlow Hill, Northumberland
